description: Former Gov. Rick Perry of Texas is announcing his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination on Thursday. Here is a look at what he will need to do if he hopes to win.
title: What Rick Perry Would Need to Do to Win
title_page: What Rick Perry Would Need to Do to Win - The New York Times
text:
Why He Won't
For all the time and focus Mr. Perry intends to apply to the early nominating states, the series of monthly debates beginning in August is likely to shape the race, and he will have to ensure that he is strong enough in national polls to win a spot on center stage. If he does, the standards will be exacting: He cannot afford anything resembling his “oops” moment from the last campaign. But all of that may be immaterial if Mr. Perry cannot escape the shadows of the many candidates lining up now who did not seek the nomination four years ago. More than anything else, Mr. Perry’s challenge is that his moment may have passed him by.
